text: Pon ye gyi (, ; also spelt pone yay gyi and pone ye gyi) is a fermented bean paste commonly used as a condiment or marinade in Burmese cuisine, especially in pork and fish dishes. Pon ye gyi is traditionally made from horse gram beans, alongside other beans. The towns of Bagan, Nyaung U and Sale, and Myingyan in the country's central dry zone are major producers of this product. ==See also== *Fermented bean paste ==References== Category:Burmese cuisine Category:Plant-based fermented foods
title: Pon ye gyi
